content.description: This route is the rightmost route on the wall (we spotted 4 routes in total) and to right/uphill of the route with two bolts right next each other (possibly Bill-bolting Baggins)   It starts on the right side of the chimney that separates tower 1 from tower 2.  Climb past two expansion bolts with light red hangers and traverse right at the bulge.  3 more button heads protect the easier upper face.  This route doesn't top out on the summit but finishes on a midway ledge.The face above the anchors looks good.   I looked for some time for more bolts but couldn't spot anything.
content.protection: 5 bolts with a two bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Eastern end of the south face.

climbs.name: Bil-Bolting-Baggins
climbs.fa: Mike Engle & Bob Archbald  Fall of 1983

content.description: Generously bolted face climb to the summit of Khazad Dum. Fun, remote climbing, without the fear associated with many of the Needles climbs.
content.protection: 8 bolts to anchors, so all you need are quickdraws. Double rope rap to the ground.
content.location: The route begins on the south face, on the second summit from the East (right) end of the rock. Look up for the first bolt and start climbing.

content.description: Probably the most remote area of Middle Earth, but worth the hike for the route Bil-Bolting-Baggins. Very secluded, great rock.
